header.headertext: AMENDMENTS TO BE MOVED ON REPORT

text.quote: 000: After Clause 12, insert the following new Clause—
“Registration of town or village green: reduction of period under section 15(3)(c)
(1) Section 15 of the Commons Act 2006 (registration of greens) is amended as follows.
(2) In subsection (3), in paragraph (c), for the words from “the period” to the end of the paragraph substitute “the relevant period”.
text.IndentOne: (a) in the case of an application relating to land in England, the period of one year beginning with the cessation mentioned in subsection (3)(b);
(b) in the case of an application relating to land in Wales, the period of two years beginning with that cessation.””

text.quote: 000: Clause 14, page 17, line 21, leave out “of two years”
000: After Clause 15, insert the following new Clause—
(1) The Town and Country Planning Act 1990 is amended as follows.
(2) In section 57(3), after “Where by a development order (or a local development order” insert “issued by the local planning authority”.
“(4) Where a local planning authority propose to make an order under this section they shall first prepare—
text.IndentOne: (a) a draft of the order; and
(b) a statement of their reasons for making the order.
text.quote: (5) The statement of reasons shall contain—
text.IndentOne: (a) a description of the development which the order would permit; and
(b) a plan or statement identifying the land to which the order would relate.
text.quote: (6) Where a local planning authority have prepared a draft local development order, they shall consult, in accordance with regulations, persons whose interests they consider would be affected by the order.””
